I‚Äôm proud of these and the over 370 bills I passed as a member of the #VALeg between over the past 18 sessions.

SB 1326 requires up to 30% of available funds in the Transit Ridership Incentive Program be used to support local, regional, and state entities in improving the accessibility of transit bus passenger facilities and improve public safety at bus stops and on buses.
SB 1499 provides greater flexibility in the appointment of the Virginia Commonwealth University Health System Authority‚Äôs chief executive officer.
SB 1460 requires appointed school boards to receive training on Virginia‚Äôs Conflict of Interest and Ethics laws and makes the filing date for filing annual disclosures consistent for all officials.

SB 1329 requires the Virginia Board of Education to create a workgroup to advise how to establish/maintain a Virginia Parent Data Portal by 2025 to allow parents/students to access and better understand their own state-supported assessment data.

SB 1498 expands eligibility for the Brown v. Board of Education Scholarship Program to direct descendants of Virginians whose education was affected by the closings of Virginia public schools to avoid desegregation from 1954-1964.
SB 1320 codifies/strengthens the CDFI Fund that I created through a 2021 budget amendment to expand economic opportunity for underserved/rural communities. The bill also expands funding eligibility.

The Energy Efficiency Savings Act (SB 1323) creates a performance standard for Dominion‚Äôs energy efficiency programs for low-income, elderly, disabled & veteran customers to ensure these programs lower their electric bills.

The Affordable Energy Act (SB 1321) will establish more accurate electric prices and protect consumers from overcharges by restoring the SCC‚Äôs historic authority to reduce rates when an electric utility earns more than its authorized profit.
New Virginia laws take effect today, including 8 of my own from my last General Assembly session.üßµ
